values:
NEWS:

This is my final semester at WMU, then I'm going into the Air Force. (Thought you'd like to know).

That is all.

Might I suggest taking a look at a very interesting PhD thesis entitled, "Evolution, Monism, Atheism and the Naturalist World-View." 

The purpose of the thesis study is as described: 

"The purpose of this study is to determine the degree to which the world's leading evolutionary biologists believe in traditional religion, naturalism, and the philosophical implications of their science. A further goal will be to understand how they reconcile these disparate and often conflicting beliefs with their teaching and practice of evolutionary biology." 

The study was conducted by Dr. Gregory Walter Graffin III (PhD Cornell University) A.K.A., Greg Graffin, the lead singer of Bad Religion.

It'ss a pretty intersting study and the fact that it was conducted by the lead singer of one the most kick ass punk bands ever just makes it that much cooler.

For more info vist: www.cornellevolutionproject.org or www.badreligion.com

With my cousin on Saturday about recent books we had read, got me to thinking that I'd like to have a place to critique and share the things of interest to me, like books, music and movies...so I decided I should make a website about it and came up with the following, its still in its early development, but eventually I plan to use it to offer my two cents on the things I read, watch, and listen to. Subsequently this journal will likely be neglected.

http://www.interpretatwill.com

This journal may soon be abandoned for a new site, that I hope to use in conjunction with the advancement of my work a freelance writer. It will likely include none of the mundane, personal, bullshit that I've put into this journal and instead more general musings on various affairs and samples of some of my writing work. More info on that once I get it up and running...and yeah I know what some of you are thinking...but I promise this won't be a flash in the pan thing like The Brown and Gold site was.

It has been a very relaxing birthday today and a little animation domination will be the perfect way to cap it off.

I experieced a birthday miracle today, I woke up rested and refreshed with no hangover, despite being very liberal with the drink last night...as some of you witnessed.

But I did have a lot of fun last night, and I got to see some old friends and made some new ones. Plus the Pistons won.

Tim on the other hand did not sure my good fortune and has pretty much been dead on his feet. Perhaps he contracted my hangover on top of his own.

So here I am another year older...and I suppose that's really it, once you hit that 21 milesotne, what else is there...40? 50? I suppose from here on its just about racking up the years and hanging on as long as you can.

So as I reflect on the past 22 years of my life...I think a few words from those San Francisco punks the Swingin' Utters would be in order:

I guess it's all right
That we never know
Just what it all means
And if there are ways
Of making a change
Please show them to me

So if I could stop time
Then I would stay 21
Cause everyday since that time
I wished I was young...

Well, I'm pushing a month since my last update so I figure I should throw you kids a bone...the primary reason for the lack of updates is that I've been sans a computer for the better part of a month. After finally getting my laptop back from repairs, it promptly and quite literaly, caught fire. So back it went to the repair center, I may not be a computer expert but I figured something was amiss when smoke started coming out the side...but anyways, the computer is back for good now *knock wood*.

Anyway, I'm still looking for gainful employment here in Kalamazoo, but its looking like I'll be able to land a job up at Shakespeare's sometime this week. 

I've been working on a lot of short fiction lately, and I've really been enjoying it. I'm currently working on a few different pieces that I'll narrow to one, and submit for fellowship consideration for the Prague program next summer.  But that's not due for awhile.

In the meantime, I'm working on some other short fiction that I plan on sending to various periodicals, including Playboy, Harper's, The New Yorker etc., that accept unsolcited short fiction. Really just for shits and giggles, but then again you never now. I figure it can't hurt, since I already missed the deadline for the Playboy college fiction contest, I might as well send some stories in now, rather than wait until next year...I'd be happy just with a rejection letter, at least I'll know they actually read it then.

My birthday is on June 5th (this coming Sunday), no solid plans yet, but at the very least I hope to spend it drinking my way around Kalamazoo with all you kids and others.

But, I've also been thinking about going to the Tiger game that day with a group and hitting the bars in the Detroit area, if there's any interest in something like that let me know...otherwise, I just hope to spend it one way or the other with all my people.
I can finally build that lakehouse. And I'll run around naked all day. HA-HA! Dangly parts...

If I don't write a manuscript, I can't get a fellowship.

If I don't get a fellowship, I can't go to Prague next summer.

I must write a manuscript. One of many projects for this summer.

Oh by the way, I moved in with Timmy this past weekend...and I'm back bitches.


P.S.
This is what part of the alphabet would look like if Q and R were eliminated.

I refuse to update my journal.

Wait...

Fuck.

Hung out with Beal up in GR for the weekend, had a good time, watched a ton of hoops and consumed a lot of free food and beer, courtesy of Mr. Beal, whom once again I can't thank enough for the hospitality.

As for the title of this little entry, that comes from a little gem of a program we discovered on GR public access proving that, given a video camera, anybody can make a hilarious program without even trying. Who would've thought the gangsta rap seen in GR would be so hardcore?

All in all a good weekend...Bronco basketball tomorrow night against Texas Christian...hopefully the all hoops weekend will end on a positive note.

Spent 8 hours at B-Dubs with Beal yesterday and met some interesting ladies who were also there for the long haul, they provided some good entertainment. Bear in mind we hadn't planned on being there that long, just planned on getting some wings for lunch and playing a little trivia...Well that turned into a little more trivia, which turned into a few beers, which turned into more trivia, more beer, more wings...and eight hours later I was on my way to Shakespeare's for Kobie's little shin dig. Beal bailed on Shakespeare's for some reason, but whatever. Got to Shakespeare's and played some more trivia with Mike for awhile, but mostly just hung out drank some beers and chilled it was a good time. 

Went back to 1420 for a bit, Kobie let me try on his pack and helmet...that shit is heavy.

Don't know what today will bring, other than cleaning the apartment, maybe 1420 tonight or maybe I'm gonna try and find a bar with the WMU game on.

My buddy Noveck is gonna come up tomorrow, maybe we'll hit the camo party...although I don't think I'm gonna have any cammo, because I really don't feel like spending the money on it.

Would anyone want to bang you? by phobia
Name:
Favorite Food:
Wants to Bang you:
This many times:146
Quiz created with MemeGen!

$550 refund from the state today on the old taxes, and only had to pay $27 to the Feds...if there's one thing that this proves its that I didn't make any fucking money last year, and spent way too much on rent (hence the big state refund, a credit for the thousands I dropped on rent in the last year)...oh well here's to a better paying job, and a cheaper place to live in 2005...got one down already.

Oh yeah, Nate and I went to Hooters for lunch and I dropped fifteen bucks, with no booze involved, who would've thought mediocre bar food would be so expensive. Apparently our waitress knew Nate, although his knowledge of their apparent relationship was shaky at best, and he just had to play along the whole time. It was amusing.
FUCK...this is boring as hell and four more days to go...can't wait to get back Kalamazoo way.

Going home tomorrow afternoon for the break, not going to be the most fun in the world, but I'm going to make some much needed monies while doing essentially nothing but sitting around and watching tv all week, so I really can't complain.

That and I have to return every so often to remind the people that I still rule Birmingham with an iron fist.

Beal and I just rolled back into Kzoo coming back from EL where we saw the Spartans kick Minnesota all over the floor at Breslin. Good time.

After the game Mr. Beal took us out to dinner, along with Beal's sister and her friend. I'll tell you that man's hospitality knows no bounds. Always class, and always a good time with the Beal's.

The trip back was a little nuts...Snow on 69 south was outrageous, visibility of MAYBE 20 feet...needless to say, that made for some tense driving. Then all of a sudden it cleared and we didn't see any snow the rest of the way, but we ended up chilling at a rest stop for about two hours just to regroup after that little episode.

Hmmm...well I guess that's it for now.

I've set my sites on the Prague Summer Program for 2006 and the Ivan Klima Fellowship for fiction writing.

Perhaps it's naive of me to even consider a fellowship at this juncture, but it's an established goal none the less. Improbable? Yes. Impossible? No.

I have less than a year to write my ass off and produce a worthy entry.

Regardless though I fully intend to enter into the Prague program, even if I have to shell out the five grand myself.

As for other shiznit': Looks like I'll be moving in with Tim in the spring.

...That I'm stealing your shit.

Is there anything I won't do? I think it's pretty obvious not, I'm shameless...I don't care what, do you want me to tie a monkey to my waste and run around? I'll do it, IF the price is right...One time I ran naked through a bowling alley for three bucks, and I earned it. Ever spit on animals at the zoo, lose your keys down the toilet? Hey, I can be bought. Did you ever give a midget a massage? 
I have....$23.

I love livin' alone, you know, I've got my own life. I'm not gonna have some girl telling me, "Hey wake up, get dressed"...I work out of the home, ain't gonna push all this frilly froo froo stuff on me like, ahhh, you know, furniture or dishes or whatever...no, we do paper plates here...It's just like when I was in high school and then I quit, I'm still bald, still single, still lovin' it.

So anyways, I'm getting ready to take my SOC 320 exam in about an hour, the one I thought was on Tuesday when I wasn't prepared to take it at all...and now I know it's today and I'm only slightly more prepared...I don't know, I think I'll do ok, I usually do fairly well on my SOC exams, the only part that worries me is the essay, but one of the benefits of being an English major and a Sociology minor is that I can BS my way through an essay fairly well.

After that, it's just a couple more classes then the weekend has come once again...What will it bring? I do not know, but I've already heard talk of more than few parties deserving of my presence, but we'll probably kick it off as usual with a little home bar action this evening, and then I wouldn't mind going to Waldo's again if other people are down, had some good times there last week.

Oh and of course Western vs. Central on the hardwood this week, Western's been slumping, but hopefully they can turn it around against the fucking Chips...should be epic.

A pox on all your cattle. Peace.

....or Happy 21st Philly B Funk (even though Philly is really 35, and I don't believe he's touched his LJ in decades)

A stern nod of approval to whoever can tell me where that title is from...


Anyways, just hitting here eating some kung pao chicken from campus kitchen, via campusfood.com...life is sweet right now.

Getting paid in a couple days, should keep me steady for the next month...thanks to my folks for tha tas always.

Classes are going fairly well, though I had a test in SOC 320 this morning, studied all night...turns out its Thursday (that's what I get for not going to lecture last week). Oh well, now I'll only have to review tomorrow night.

Rented "Mercenaries" on the XBOX, seems pretty sweet, kind of like a millitary version of GTA.

Well, I'm spent...later chitlins...that's right, I said chitlins.

While I sit alone in this room, I've got crates full of sorrow even more filled with shadows that I fish out and ridicule when I'm feeling lonely. I'm lacking sense, but bound in a very specific direction it's phenomenal and unprecedented it's a chip of the old block and a step up the new ladder. Mr.Scribe, I write to you pen and penchant aimed to pour over a fool left with no more rhymes I'm poetically franchised. I'm in charge for the day in terminal wanderlust I've excited my worst thoughts exorcised what was lost am I a bad seed sprouting up or am I not? I'm not sure what sad is, but listless I'm not, my lists are never ending and my emotions aren't store-bought and tears, they either deceive or endear me, I'm your little golden nugget collecting dust, bored with my own stale and directed thoughts, in a place where so much life and loves abound, it's a amazing how little tempts me from my glass house.

I keep telling myself I need to stop spending so much money, but how can I when I have so much fun with my friends.

A lot of fun last night hanging at Waldo's, Newcastle and pitchers of Gin & 7-UP are always good. Saw a ton of people I knew there, most writers and former colleagues of mine at the paper, and some old friends who I hadn't seen in a year or more...all in all great times last night.

I thought some Swingin' Utters lyrics might capture the spirit of the night:


As I walked alone in Camden
The city's sights and smells did permeate my senses
I stepped inside the local off license
And proceeded with ample gallon in my hand
We drank to the brink of dawn
And wallowed in the crimson bliss
Shouted, laughed and sang for hours
"How had I ever missed this?"
A fetching femme fatale in green glass
Turns me into a graceless gymnast
A sanguine mood turns into a sanguinary thirst
But I'd never wish to lift this vampiric curse.

So what've I been up to lately not a whole lot...this that and other...so I'll just cover the most recent.

FINALLY cleaned my apartment, its looking pretty good, though I wonder if anybody is ever going to see it, since nobody ever comes to see me.

Anyways, was lazy pretty much all day today, saw Rachel at the Bernhard center for all of a nano-second, shortest meeting between two people ever...but its still nice to run into people you know at random times.

Road tripped it down to Elkhart, Indiana with Ian tonight to watch two Broncos recruits hoop it up against each other, had a good time, and it provided decent enough fodder for an article to set the site off in its new direction.

I'll be doing the Bronco hoops thing tomorrow, but as part of the new direction of the site I won't be doing a recap of the game, probably more of a column/feature instead.

Anyways, off to bed because I've got BIO lab tomorrow...always fun.

Peace.
The site is up and running, http://www.thebrownandgold.com/, check it out and spread the word...only two stories so far, but trust me, they'll start to snow ball pretty quick.

But I bowled like absolute shit tonight, the worst I've done, well ever as far as I can remember. I kept pushing the ball the ball to the right, and when I'd try to adjust I'd push it to the left. Luckily the team we were supposed to bowl against didn't show, so we won by default.

Semester kicks off tomorrow, but not for me with no Monday classes this time around. Still I'm looking forward to getting back and improving on things from last semester, and obviously, there's a lot of room for improvement.

Wow, crazy times last night for New Year's...had a pretty good time drank a 12 of Molson and eventually just started drinking whatever my friends had in their hand at the time...Peach wine stolen from Beal really hit the spot...All in all it was a pretty good time, not the greatest, but still nice to be able to spend New Year's with friends...just wish I could have had a New Year's Eve kiss this year...oh well. 

Big thanks to Shavonne for driving me back to Beal's last night and back to Kobe's this morning to get my car, and thanks to Mike for getting me to pass out on the couch instead of the floor.

Came home this morning to a somewhat surprising message on the IM...and it really made me realize something, a situation can really only be awkward from my perspective, if I decide to make it awkward, or percieve it as so...I don't ever want my friends to feel like they have to apologize for their actions, when I'm really the one at fault...because truth be told I would've done the exact same thing if the roles were reversed.

Rose bowl in about an hour, then who knows. I hope for some more fun tonight.

TEN YEARS AGO, I:
1. Was 11 
2. Had a stupid haircut.
3. Dreamed of being an NFL and Baseball star...like Neon Deon or Bo
4. Was in middle school

FIVE YEARS AGO, I:
1. Got my car.
2. Realized I'd never be an NFL or baseball star.
3. Was a sophomore in high school.
4. Wirked at Hollywood Market.

THREE YEARS AGO, I:
1. Graduated from high school.
2. Started at Western and lived in room 301 of Garneau Hall.
3. Hated my roommate.
4. Learned that independence is the greatest thing ever.

ONE YEAR AGO, I:
1. Changed my major.
2. Was living in Hidden Hills with the roommate from hell and her boyfriend, Satan.
3. Failed my first class ever, and vowed to not let it happen again..so much for that.
4. Had a failed business venture.

SO FAR THIS YEAR, I:
1. Changed my major again.
2. Turned 21.
3. Made a lot of great friends.
4. Discovered Home Bar.

YESTERDAY, I:
1. Worked for my dad.
2. Played video games.
3. Watched movies.
4. Bought a new jacket.

TODAY, I:
1. Bought some clothes
2. Did some laundry
3. Worked for my dad.
4. Started getting ready to go back to Kzoo.

TOMORROW,I :
1. Hope to have lunch with some friends before I leave.
2. Will drive back to Kzoo.
3. Will drink some beer.
4. Hang out with friends.

IN ONE YEAR I WILL:
1. Four years into the five year plan
2. Hopefully know more than I know now.
3. Hopefully will have a lot more writing work done, with the website at full tilt and more print work.
4. Hope to have written the draft of my first novel.

Been home for a week now, and haven't been able to get online much, but I haven't really missed it either, except for talking to friends, I waste entirely too much time online when I'm at school...

Speaking of which, FYI I will be back at school next semester that was kind of up in the air for awhile though...but fear not I will return to regale you all with my witty antecdotes.

I'm getting my wisdom teeth out on Monday...that should be a real treat, so my plan of returning to Kzoo by Monday or Tuesday will be put on hold until Wednesday or Thursday.

Hope to see most of you then, and we can party hard for New Years...I don't as of yet have any concrete plans, other than to find some friends and have a hell of a good time.

See y'all soon.

So I'll be heading home tonight, and I don't plan on being back in Kzoo until after Christmas...definitely back in time for New Years because that has to be spent with friends.

Anyways, like I said I'll be going home until after Christmas, the fact that I can make $20 an hour for the next week working for my Dad is just too great to pass up...plus I really need the money.

So if anybody needs me, you know my cell or number or should know people who do...I'll try and get online when I can, but it probably won't be much, but feel free to call the cell anytime.

Happy Holidays, bitches. Peace

So, I'm a little late on this one but oh well...

Thursday was supposed to be my last two final exams, but thanks to my ever increasing ability to complicate my life, I slept through my morning exam and had to take it on Friday morning...this of course came after a long night celebrating the not quite end of the semester at 1420...

1420, wow some crazy shit happened that night...some things I regret (see Jeremy's journal) and I mistook Beal for Ron Artest...but that was kinda funny. I think I did find my new calling, along with Tim, working the bar at Club 1420...we both had a blast doing that.

Saturday, not much doing during the day, went up to GR with Mike and Beal, and drank a lot of free beer and ate a lot of free food at the Beal family Christmas party good times. Came home this afternoon in time to watch the Lions blow a 13-0 halftime lead at Lambeau and lose 16-13 to the Packers. That leaves the lions 0 for the last 13 years at Lambeau. Pathetic.

I've also come to the realization that I have two options right now, option the first: I can continue to pine over completely unattainable people and throw away the opportunity for a great friendship. Or, option the second: I can stop worrying about things that I can't attain in one aspect, and work on building a relation ship in another way. Option one, leaves me miserable and frustrated. Option two, leaves me with the potential for a great friendship.

I think the choice is clear...

I just want a lover like any other
What do I get
I only want a friend who will stay to the end
What do I get

What do I get
Oh oh what do I get
What do I get
Oh oh what do I get

I'm in distress I need a caress
What do I get
I'm not on the make I just need a break

Boy oh boy...that last post, thats what happens when you've been up all night studying and you're so wired on caffeine you can't even see straight...Whew...post with caution kids. Wow.

Sleep is for pussies and finals are for nerds...

And while I'm at a big screw you to emotions, because they've got me all fucked up in the head...

Hahaha...get it? It's cuz I'm shopping for a bass guitar, its a play on words...ah forget it.

Anyways, team Cool Club is 2-0 in the Sunday bowling league...as if you'd expect anything different.

No finals Monday or Tuesday, but a whole lot of studying and probably not much else, so that kind of sucks, but the semester is almost done, so I can't complain.

Really want to get a bass, but I don't think the folks will get me one, not after the previous failed guitar experiment from high school, so I think I'll probably have to gather up the cash I get from relatives and wait until after Christmas.

I also want some DVD's and clothes and shit, that I will get from my folks...

But in reality there's only one thing that I want for Christmas, and I'd glady trade all that other stuff to get it, but I think there's a better chance of me getting crushed by Jupiter, than there is of me actually getting it...Alas.

Listen to "Detroit" by Rancid...best bass line to open a song ever...

Well, I've succesfuly mastered the art of the awkward single guy...now hopefully i can move onto phase two, awkward not single guy.

Oh punk if only you knew, its killing me inside...

i'm looking at another day to find that i've got nothing to say,
or i'm looking for another way to process what happened on that birthday,
and either way, if you're gonna call it art,
then there's a cup in front of you and right away,
if you're gonna play your part, you must drink it down.
but mind eyes have seen the glory
of the fields of flowers and factory floors,
and my mind's content to lie at rest for hours
behind my loved ones' doors and if there's a war,
another shitty war to fight for babylon,
then it's the perfect storm in a tea cup,
but you must drink it down.
and what do you make of the nights
when you thought you'd make much more
than being too tired to turn the lights out
and too drunk to drink more?
and what does it take to not hear the cynics at your door saying
"it's time the turn the lights out, and you'll want to keep it down!"
so i'm lifting up that poison cup to drink a draught of propoganda,
or i'm giving up that other stuff in hopes that it will make me madder.
but either way, if you're gonna call it art,
then there's a cup in front of you and right away,
if you're gonna play your part,
you must drink it down.
and what do you make of nights
when you thought you'd make much more
than being too tired to turn the lights out
and too drunk to drink more?
and what does it take to not hear the cynics at your door saying
"it's time the turn the lights out, and you'll want to keep it down!"
and what does it say of all the things you've said before,
when you're too drunk to turn the lights out
and too tired to drink more?
and what do you save, and what does it feel like to be saved?
and can you "pull - 2 - 3 - 4! pull - 2 - 3 - 4!"
can you drink it down?

www.thebrownandgold.com

I'm preparing to launch thebrownandgold.com, a new site for all things related to WMU athletics. If you think you might be interested in contributing let me know. This is a serious media venture designed to help further my pursuit of a career in sports journalism. I hope that it can become a place that all Bronco fans can come to for entertaining and informative content.

Well...I guess thats enough shameless self-promotion for now. 

Peace.

Well it would seem that once again I've managed to over analyze things and create problems in my mind that don't really exist...I have to stop doing this, because one day its really going to cost me.

That aside...

Thanksgiving was nice, 5 days at home was a pretty long stretch for me, but it was nice. Just good to get away from everything. While I was home, I was also able to get the breaks replaced on my car, and put the snow tires on, so I'm ready to combat another Kzoo winter, with my four cylinders of fury.

Of course, now that I'm back I'm left to face the last week of classes and final exams, should just be tons of fun as always. 

Still trying to figure out what's going to be happening in terms of a writing job, hopefully I can get some steady work with the Gazette soon. I've also been thinking about starting my own internet publication, just for fun if nothing else, but it'd be cool if I could really get something solid on developed...more on that later though. And of course...my novel is always a work in progress.

Oh and I got new glasses when I was home, nothing too different, but I still refuse to be enslaved by contacts.

~Out

Well, I returned to the B'Ham last night. First time I've been home since August, and so far its hasn't been as bad as I remember, I guess I just really needed to get away from school and that zoo in the 'Zoo for a bit.

I'm kinda dissapointed to find out that so many people are planning to go out tonight, kind of made me wish I was still in Kzoo. But then, I thought to myself what the appeal of being hungover on Thanksgiving was, and I couldn't think of a good reason, why anybody would want to be hungover on Thanksgiving...Before they start drinking for the Lions game that as...Because lets face it, its going to take a lot to get through that one. Good thing I brought those growlers of OP Pumpkin Ale home.

Well, I'm out. Don't know when I'll be back in Kzoo, but its looking more and more like Sunday now.

So I guess Nick, Nate, and I are like the three fuckin' jilted musketeers...but whatever, as we long as we stick together it'll be ok...or something...like Beal's ambiguous shirt says "Bros before Hos"...of course as a writer I've always preferred "Prose before Hos".


Anyways...I'm going back to Birmingham tomorrow after class, don't know how long I'll be staying, Sunday morning at the latest, but probably be back sooner. I probably won't be online much, if at all, so if you need to reach me just hit the cell.

Peace.
